title: What are the sugars made during photosynthesis? - Quora

response.answer_text: Glucose is made during photosynthesis. The extras glucose not used by the plant can be stored in the form of starch. The cell walls are made of starch, which is the primary use of starch in the plant. The glucose can also be stored in other parts of the plant. Glucose can also be stored as fats and oils. Glucose can also be converted to sucrose and stored in fruits, the stem, the roots, and the seeds… Glucose can also be used in the formation of amino acids that can be used for protein synthesis.
